intro: Stygnanthe moesta, commonly known as the Brazilian starflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soil and full sun. Stygnanthe moesta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
